channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TX
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for TX

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS BEING UNLOADED AND IT WAS LEAKING AND QA WAS CALLED TO GET THE PACKAGE DescribePack: THE ACID LEAKED OUT OF THE CLOSURES ON THE BATTERY DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED INSIDE A SALVAGE DRUM

item.title: Report X-2024021248
item.description:
Report X-2024021248

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-10
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the AFWH facility a fiberboard box was found with signs of release. The fiberboard box contained two fire extinguishers packaged with foam padding top and bottom. One of the extinguishers released its contents inside of the fiberboard box. The gauge of the extinguisher showed as empty. Consignee picked up the shipment at the location.

item.title: Report X-2024021220
item.description:
Report X-2024021220

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on the floor upside down near a load door with wet marks on the corners. When placed in tote, the top side was wet as well. DescribePack: Moisture was present throughout box. The two bottles inside the inner box had small holes on the caps. One leaked due to a torn paper seal underneath the cap. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage did not spread beyond the width of the box. Once box was placed in tote lined with Hazmat bag, an absorbent pad was used to clean up the residue.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics (LDA) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift puncture, approximately 5gallons of Emulsinator (hazardous - UN1760) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor and has dried. The terminal advised the release has dried and there is no release to clean.

item.title: Report X-2024021217
item.description:
Report X-2024021217

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-14
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found on a cart in QA damage area wrapped in a plastic bag. One side of the box was wet and partly torn. DescribePack: All 3 bottles inside the box were still mostly full when inspected and no active leakage was found. Prior leakage is suspected as dry crust was seen around the cap of the middle bottle. 1 side bottle was wet. Test strip showed a pH12 when applied to the moisture on the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Box was placed in a tote lined with a Hazmat bag, then transported to Hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2024021144
item.description:
Report X-2024021144

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-12
  • City: FORT WORTH
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Box was found in QA damage area with a small stain on the top of the box. Shipping label was faded. Tracking number was identified on OP-900 label. DescribePack: Upon inspection, 1 of the 6 metal cans of Sunnyside Denatured Alcohol had a small leak seeping from the cap. Other cans were not wet or leaking when examined and turned upside down. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Leakage was not spreading. Box was wrapped in a Hazmat bag when found and placed in a carrying tote for transport to Hazmat area.

The whereabout of the missing is unknown but it is believe to be the one that was damaged based on the condition and smell of the box and other three jerricans. item.title: Report E-2024020520
item.description:
Report E-2024020520

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-29T18:14:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-22
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 22, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails and four (4) 1-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel arrived and assessed the site. LSH personnel deployed granular absorbents to the paint-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 5-gallon pail. The damaged containers of product were placed into one (1) 55-gallon drum. All containers were staged onsite for future disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024021184

DescribePack: the seal on one of the bottles had come loose causing it to leak. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Box was moved to the hazmat cage for it to be processed and the bay doors were open.

item.title: Report X-2024021116

Due to the broken cap, this jerrican is no longer in safe shipping condition. However, the box and the other remaining jerricans are still in good shipping condition. item.title: Report X-2024021519
item.description:
Report X-2024021519

  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: HAZMAT ADMIN CALLED BY UNLOAD MANAGER TO CLEAN SPILL OUTSIDE OF DOCK DOOR. BOX WAS PLACED IN A LINED RED HAZMAT TOTE. SPILL WAS CLEANED WITH ABSORBENT, SWEPT UP AND PLACED IN A BLUE HAZMAT BAG. DescribePack: 1 OF 4 BOTTLES WAS SPLIT OPEN UNDER BOTTLE'S INDENTATION. SPLIT APPROXIMATELY 4" LONG. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: BOTTLE WAS CLEANED AND SPLIT WAS TAPED OVER. ABSORB PAD WAS TAPED OVER TAPED UP SPLIT. BOTTLE WAS WRAPPED IN SHRINK WRAP AND PLACED IN AN INDUSTRIAL ZIPLOCK BAG. ALL CLEAN UP MATERIALS, BOX AND INNER PARTITION WERE PLACED IN A BLUE HAZMAT BAG. ALL CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN A LINED SALVAGE DRUM AND ZIP-TIED CLOSED.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package handler called for a damaged hazmat, QA removed hazmat from the trailer being unloaded and took it to the hazmat cage for inspection. Upon inspection it was found that the plastic pail/drum inside of the package had a large crack going along its side that ran about 1FT, causing the powdered contents to leak out. DescribePack: Inadequate bracing for the pail inside, caused large 1FT crack to form during shipping. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat was placed into a Hazardous materials only bin and removed from the unload and brought to the stations Hazmat cage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg was loaded and scanned as delivered, pkg was picked up and leak was noticed. Given to QA when the driver arrived back to the station. QA immediately transported the damage hazmat in a lined hazardous tote to the hazmat processing area. DescribePack: Loose closure at top of bottle. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The truck the pkg was loaded on was properly cleaned of spilled material. Driver was informed on how to deal with damaged hazardous material ad how to safely transport them to the station.

item.title: Report X-2024020928
item.description:
Report X-2024020928

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-27T18:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: MISSOURI CITY
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was repacked by an unauthorized personnel. It was loaded onto a truck leaking with the orientation arrows not facing upwards and the driver did not notice till the end of his route. He returned the package back to station as needing an inspection and it was discovered during VSA. Once inspected, the truck and area was temporarily evacuated. The hazardous material was transported to the hazardous processing area in a lined hazardous tote. DescribePack: 4 bottles had either a cracked or loose closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: QA team members were told the correct procedures of handling a damage hazmat so no further damage can occur. The driver was informed of the actions he should take when a hazardous material is leaking on their truck.

DescribePack: Upon inspection, a dry wet mark was seen on the lower part of the outer box. All six metal cans inside of the box were bent and dented. No active leakage could be found although cans were tested, being turned sideways and upside down. One corner looked most likely to be a puncture hole on a can that felt less full than the others. A strong smell was detected emanating from the box. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: No active leakage was found. Box was secure in a tote when found.

The released product was contained to the concrete dock floor. The SDS was reviewed, and the caller determined terminal personnel were capable of conducting clean up in house. There were no drains, soil, or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 5-gallons of UN1210 "Proshine GS Yellow" from a 55-gallon metal drum caused by a forklift puncture that impacted their trailer floor. No storm drains or waterways were reported to be impacted by the release. The released product and damaged 55-gallon drum were containerized and overpacked into a 65-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024030004
item.description:
Report E-2024030004

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: HOUSTON
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics (LHO) reported that due to the top shaking loose in transit, approximately 5 gallons of Benco - Industrial Paint Remover (hazardous - UN3066) was released. It was stated that the released product was contained outside the container, and did not impact the dock floor. They advised there is no release to clean up. The damaged jug and remaining contents will be placed into a 10 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. ERTS will upload the BOL, SDS and create a waste container entry. A DOT5800 is required due to the hazardous state and packing group (II).

item.title: Report X-2024021337

  • City: HUTCHINS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A tugger placed on edge of their cart while they were heading back to the even side of the unload. When they turned the corner, the package fell off the cart and stared leaking. Hazmat team was called to come clean up the spill. DescribePack: The package was leaking through all edges and bottom of the box. When the box was opened to see what was damaged, only one jerrican had a cap that came loose. The remaining two jerrican are still in good condition. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed inside a hazmat bag and the spill was cleaned up using gloves, broom and absorbent.

The package was then set on a yellow cart to be picked up by an Ops Admin. I picked up the package and took it to damage HazMat's for inspection. DescribePack: The inner metal can is dented, and a small hole appears to have opened at the bottom. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a Hazmat spill bin.

item.title: Report X-2024020571

Report X-2024020571

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: EL PASO
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: X-2024020571-TCLX 1153 was found to have released diesel fuel from the top of the car. Inspection found the manway swing bolts less than tool tight, releasing approximately five gallons of fuel to the top of the car and to the ballasted right-of-way. The bolts were tightened, resecuring the car. X-2024020572 TCLX 1572 was found to have released diesel fuel from the top of the car. Inspection found the manway swing bolts less than tool tight, releasing approximately five gallons of fuel to the top of the car and to the ballasted right-of-way. The bolts were tightened, resecuring the car. X-2024020573 TCLX 1288 was found to have released diesel fuel from the top of the car. Inspection found the manway swing bolts less than tool tight, releasing approximately five gallons of fuel to the top of the car and to the ballasted right-of-way. The bolts were tightened, resecuring the car.
